li.a: Latest School Closure Info & News during COVID-19 shutdown
Online Curriculum Resources during COVID-19 shutdown
Free Food Sites & Times During COVID-19 Shutdown
School Board Meeting Agendas and Minutes Archive
Why I Choose Rutherford County Schools

div.div: While nothing can replace face-to-face interaction with an educator, access to instructional materials is essential during an extended closure.

Beginning the week of April 6, 2020, RCS will offer optional assignments and activities to keep students engaged throughout the COVID-19 shutdown. New assignments will be added for each week of the shutdown. Teachers in all content areas will be sharing supplemental resources via their websites and will provide feedback on submitted assignments, although a grade will not be given.

If a student needs a device to work from home, schools will be making arrangements for students to check out a device. Please check with your school or check their website/social media for details. Printed packets can also be made available, as needed. Again, check with your school about those arrangements.
In addition to the weekly assignments and activities, you can also find multiple resources listed below, broken down by grade level.

Tennessee is also partnering with PBS television to offer daily programing with teachers providing lessons (MORE INFO) and two local Internet Service Providers are offering free high speed internet service for two months (MORE INFO).
To access online textbooks, follow this link.

PW Hint = your child’s school lunch number (true for K-5 students only)

div.p: 3. For login assistance contact the school’s Instructional Technology Coach

p.strong: Resources for Students with Learning Differences

strong.span: Resources for students with learning differences

div.p: This document is intended as a resource in coordination with “RCS Learning Plan (Covid-19)” to support students with learning differences during school closure due to Covid-19. We urge school teams and families to focus first on the health, safety, and well-being of students. We encourage flexibility and collaboration while schools remain closed. Rutherford County Schools is deeply committed to supporting educational opportunities for all students. We appreciate the collective effort of students, families, teachers, and support staff as we rise to the challenge of supporting our students and families during school closure.

Students are encouraged to use the Microsoft Edge Browser's Read Aloud feature when accessing District Learning Resources because it will read the PDF file in the browser. All RCS student devices have this browser installed. Contact building-level support for check out times and dates.

p.strong: General Accommodations for Students with Learning Differences

p.span: Print or pull up one of the linked feelings charts. Have your child point to or talk about how s/he is feeling every morning. You can model this by talking about how you are feeling and why. Feel free to use these charts throughout the day as feelings change for you and/or your child. You can also make your own feelings chart with pictures of your child’s feelings.
